page.title: 19Employment in Featherstone.
page.content: Featherstone is part of the Castleford and Pontefract travel to work area.The whole area had a total unemployment figure of 7719 on the 13th June 1985. This was 13.3 percent and is almost identical to the national figure of 13.4 percent.The unemployment figures of the area have not usually varied much from the national ones. The major employer the Ackton Hall colliery has just closed but most of the men under 50years of age have been found work in other collieries nearby. Those over 50 have been offered early retirement and redundancy. The old miners welfare building has been turned in to a centre for small businesses usually one-man businesses. There are two sewing works employing women,and a small engineering works. There is little opportunity for youth.
